See also: Leider

Dutch[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From leiden +‎ -er.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈlɛi̯.dər/
  • Audio
    		(file)
  • Hyphenation: lei‧der
  • Rhymes: -ɛi̯dər

Noun[edit]

leider m (plural leiders, diminutive leidertje n)

  1. leader, head, chief

Derived terms[edit]

  • bedrijfsleider
  • berenleider
  • leiderschap
  • marktleider
  • oppositieleider
 

Related terms[edit]

  • leidster f

Anagrams[edit]

  • delier, erelid

German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From Old High German leidir, equivalent to the comparative form of leid.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈlaɪ̯dɐ/
  • audio
    		(file)

Adverb[edit]

leider

  1. unfortunately

Synonyms[edit]

  • unglücklicherweise

Antonyms[edit]

  • glücklicherweise

Further reading[edit]

  • leider in Duden online

Norwegian Bokmål[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From Low German leider, compare with German Leiter

Noun[edit]

leider m (definite singular leideren, indefinite plural leidere, definite plural leiderne)

  1. (especially nautical) a ladder

References[edit]

  • “leider” in The Bokmål Dictionary.
  • “leider” in Det Norske Akademis ordbok (NAOB).

Norwegian Nynorsk[edit]

Etymology 1[edit]

From Low German leider

Noun[edit]

leider m (definite singular leideren, indefinite plural leiderar, definite plural leiderane)

  1. (especially nautical) a ladder

Etymology 2[edit]

Noun[edit]

leider f

(non-standard since 1938)

  1. indefinite plural of leid

Etymology 3[edit]

Verb[edit]

leider

  1. (non-standard since 1938) present of leida

References[edit]

  • “leider” in The Nynorsk Dictionary.
